==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).

===Etymology===
No known cognate exists. It can perhaps be compared with Proto-{{cog|kar}} {{m|und|*məŋᴮ||trunk (of a tree); firewood}} ({{zh-ref|Starostin}}) or Proto-Lolo-Burmese {{m|und|*ʔmuk||stump (of a tree)}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

The common Sino-Tibetan root for “tree; wood” is {{m|sit-pro|*siŋ ~ sik}}, represented by {{och-l|薪|firewood}}.

{{ja-kanji|grade=1|rs=木00}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[もく]] (moku)
|kanon=[[ぼく]] (boku)

}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|き}}
{{IPAchar|/ki<sub>2</sub>/}}: {{IPAchar|[kɨ]}}, from {{IPAchar|[ki]}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=き}}. Likely developed from fusion of older form ''ko'' + {{m|ja|い|tr=i|pos=emphatic nominative particle}}, similar to the sound changes at work in {{m|ja|神}} in the shift from ''kamu'' to ''kami''.

Now the modern {{etyl|ja|-}} word.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|き|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|き}}

# a [[tree]]; a [[shrub]]
# [[wood]], [[timber]], [[lumber]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=き|graph theory|computer science}} a [[tree]] (data structure)

=====Idioms=====
* {{ja-r|猿も木から落ちる|さる も き から おちる}}: “even monkeys fall from trees”, i.e. even experts make mistakes

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|け}}
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=け}}. Possibly an intermediate form. Obsolete in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, and never found in isolation; remains in certain place names. Even in ancient times, its use was apparently limited to eastern dialects.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|け}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|け}}

# a [[tree]]
#: {{ux|ja|麻都能'''氣'''乃 奈美多流美礼波 伊波妣等乃 和例乎美於久流等 多々理之母己呂|tr=松の'''木'''の 並みたる見れば 家人の 我れを見送ると 立たりしもころ<br
/>まつの'''け'''の なみたるみれば いはびとの われをみおくると たたりしもころ<br
/>''Matsu no '''ke''' no / namitaru mireba / iwabito no / ware o miokuru to / tatari shi mokoro''|t=Looking at the pine '''trees''' all in a row, they were just like the people from the household standing to see me off|ref=<ref>{{RQ:Manyoshu|20|4375}}; [http://etext.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man20Yo.html#4375 text here]</ref>}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|こ}}
{{IPAchar|/ko<sub>2</sub>/}}: {{IPAchar|[kə]}}, from {{IPAchar|[ko̞]}}

{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=こ}}. Likely the original form. Obsolete in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, and never found in isolation; only found in compounds and certain idioms.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|こ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こ}}

# a [[tree]]

* {{ja-l|木霊|こだま|kodama}}
* {{ja-l|木隠れ|こがくれ|kogakure}}
* {{ja-l|木陰|こかげ|kokage}}

{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|もく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=もく}} {{zh-l|木|tr=muwk}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading, so likely the original borrowing. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{zh-l|木|tr=muk6}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|もく|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|もく}}

# a [[tree]]
# short for {{ja-l|木曜日||Mokuyōbi}}: [[Thursday]]
#: When written in [[romaji]], often capitalized as {{ja-l|||Moku}}.
# [[wood]] [[grain]]
#: Often written {{ja-l|杢}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぼく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ほく'}} {{zh-l|木}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading, so likely a later borrowing. Compare literary {{etyl|nan|-}} {{zh-l|木|tr=[[bo̍k]]}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|ぼく|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|ぼく}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ほく'|derogatory}} [[wooden]], as of a person's [[character]] or [[behavior]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ほく'|derogatory}} [[wooden]], as of a person's [[mental]] [[abilities]]: [[blockheaded]], [[stupid]], [[dimwitted]]

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぼく}}

# a [[tree]]; more specifically, a [[living]] tree
# the [[bent]] and [[gnarl]]ed [[trunk]] or [[root]]s of an old tree
# [[wood]], [[lumber]]
# something made of [[wood]]
# in ancient China, a [[wooden]] [[musical]] [[instrument]]

{{der-top}}
{{der-bottom}}
